text: Ruby brown with a thin silky film . Taste port oak hint of toffee quite smooth suprisingly light in body nice but prefered the jacobite ale from here.
. 33l bottle @Bomb. Pours dark mahogany brown with low head. Aroma is nuts, caramel, brown sugar, dark malts and brown sugar. Flavor is mostly same but some syrup and alcohol notes. Swell!

Bottle from Beers of Europe,near Kings Lynn. Drunk at home. Light to mid-brown with a reddish hue. Translucent with a small white head. Toffee aroma with light whisky notes in the aroma. Theres also a slight whiff of sulphur. Strong, sweet taste with some peppery hops. Long finish starts sweet but the sweetness fades leaving a trace of dry hoppy bitterness. Aftertaste of dates and rye bread with more whisky. This is pretty special.

Découverte dans un verre "3 loups",belle robe brune aux reflets rubis surmontée dune mousse ivoire peu persistante avec une bonne carbonatation.Le nez nous offre des arômes chocolatés qui disparaissent rapidement pour laisser la place à des notes boisées et vineuses.La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs à limage du nez avec des pointes de whisky tourbé,une fine amertume et légère sécheresse qui restent en finale,sans aucune lourdeur.Un ensemble assez complexe ,bien réussi! Vive lécosse !18/20

Dégustée dans un verre "Les 3 Loups".
Température de début 9 à 10°.
Belle robe brun sombre à reflets roux presque opaque.
Mousse ivoire assez persistante; carbonatation moyenne.
Nez très subtil fruité et chocolaté avec de discrets arômes de houblon.
Le goût est tout aussi agréable avec douceur et amertume qui se bousculent en un bouquet de saveurs riches et complexes: notes florales et de café avec des touches boisées et de malts de whisky.
La finale est longue et douce mais sans aucune lourdeur avec le retour du chocolat.
Encore une grande réussite en provenance dEcosse ... je vais me mettre à la cornemuse!!!!
18/20
Bottle. Dark brown with a small head. Malty flavours dominate. Medium body with a lingering malty aftertaste.

Très belle bière ambrée sombre avec de beaux reflets pourpres et une très fine mousse ivoire... Nez sur le caramel et le malt à Whisky avec un alcool qui me semble plutôt relevé malgré ce "petit" 7.2% abv. Un très joli côté vin cuit avec des effluves puissants de Porto, de Pineau des Charentes ou de Muscat de Rivesaltes. Du fruit donc, avec ce raisin fermenté, des notes de pruneau, de prune et de mirabelle. En bouche, texture souple, soyeuse, presque huileuse. Alcool efficient, amertume légère mais astringence tannique plutôt élevée avec une belle sécheresse au palet qui contrecarre le côté soyeux sur la langue, levures en arrière-bouche, terreuses et boisées. Les sucres sont assez légers tandis que ce sont les esters qui donnent cette puissance à lalcool. Les notes boisées, terreuses, tourbées combinées aux malts et à de bonnes saveurs de noix font de ce breuvage totalement dans lesprit dune Scotch Ale. On décèle aussi en rétro-olfaction de grosses notes de tabac et de fumée que je retrouve en particulier dans la Tequila et surtout le Mescal. Je ne mattendais pas un jour à retrouver des notes de Mescal dans une bière ! Mais bon, elles sont bien là pour mon plus grand plaisir. La longueur est moyenne, le final est justement sur ces notes de bois fumés et de tourbe. Pas dune grande complexité, pas des plus gourmandes, mais cette bière propose de très belles flaveurs quon ne rencontre pas dans toutes les bières à commencer par les Scotch Ale dont elle se réclame (à juste titre). Une bière racée et élégante. Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

0,33 bottle @ The Oak Barrell, Helsinki-Vantaa Airport. Appearance is dark brown with a small head - looks like coffee. Taste reminds me somewhat Irish coffee a cold one. Coffee like malts combined with taste of alcohol, but in balance. Very smooth.

Flaska. Klar mörkbrun med röda inslag. Smutsvitt skum. Dofter av karamell, trä och övermogen frukt. Smakinslag av karamell, vanilj, trä, läder och sötade körsbär. Medelstor kropp. Lätt beska i avslutningen.

330ml bottled 2016-06-28, best before 2026-06-28. Pour dark reddish brown wit a fast disappearing foam that stays as a ring. Aroma of classic Scottish Old Ale plus wood, roasted malt and caramel. Taste caramel, scotch liquor tickling and dark malt. Medium body and high carbonation for the style. Sweet and slick feel. Long scotch finish

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2017 Virra dal bruno. Schiuma grossolana e poco persistente. All?olfatto sentori di legno e malto. Al palato corposa co note di malto, miele e legno liquoroso. Nel dinale rimane lievemente amara. Una vuona birra.

Mycket vackert rubinröd med medelstort skum, I doften finns: en underton av kaffe och russin, men mest mörka körsbär och fruktkola. I smaken finns en aning kaffe och torkade frukt men mest mörka bär och frukter, lite vinös, sträva ekfatstoner, liten balanserande beska. Stor, rund och mjuk munkänsla, En suverän Barley wine som trots sin fruktsötma inte blir sliskig.

Bottle. Dark ruby-red. Very malty, sweet, dark-fruity, strong ale. Treacly roast malt, lighter caramel, molasses, bitter chocolate balanced by hop bitterness. Whiskylike, smooth, warming. Great beer. (2008)
33cl bottle at home. Pale dark brown with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with low to moderate carbonation. Raisin, caramel, malts, herbs, ripe fruits and grain. Very nice.

Bottle from a Mitra store in Eindhoven, Netherlands!

Bought in 2009! Bbe date 11/2017. Pours deep black with a nice white head. Aroma has caramel, nutes, licorice and toffee. Taste is sweet caramel, hazelnut, toffee and some chocolate. Well aged oak notes in Finish! Wow, amazing beer!!

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Opaque brown-black color, smooth beige head that stays at 1", stripes of lace. Taste is toasted malt that blooms through medium fizz to a toffee and light hop finish. Full-bodied, rich, complex, whats not to like?
Love both Traquair House and Traquair Jacobite equally. Cant pick between the two.

Zapach intensywny, słód, czekolada, słodkie owoce, karmel, drewno. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku umiarkowana słodycz, średnia pełnia, słód, karmel, czekolada, toffi, suszone owoce, drewno. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.

330ml bottle. Small head, minimal lacing. Aroma of toasted malts, chocolate, a little alcohol and wood. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter, dry on the finish with notes of pepper and wood. The palate is medium bodied and chocolatey smooth. Carbonation is light. This is a full flavoured and very good brew.

Bottle at home. Pours a crystal clear dark brown with. Short lived pale tan foam. Nose is intense and rich, very malty, with fruity estery notes. Taste is sweet, malty, with lightly bitter hop notes. Palate is full bodied, very smooth. Carbonation is a wee bit coarse. Very good.

Bottle @home, The I cant believe they voted for Trump tasting (Nov 8th). Pours dark brown, with a tan head. Nose is chocolate, nutty, toffee. Taste is more of the same but with a big vanilla sweet finish.
330ml bottle. Dark reddish brown with a big off white head that fizzed away quite quickly. Aroma is sweet, fruit, alcohol. Flavour matches with a soft, woody finish. Good

A deep brown almost black body with a very thin white head that didnt leave much lace. Aroma of malt, caramel, and a hint of licorice. Flavor was similar to the aroma with the flavors taking on a toasted, nutty flavor, kinda earthy. Overall a very smooth beer thats worth a try. Originally rated on 10/23/08
Clearish brownish reddish beerish. Aroma is woody and fruity, wet grain. Fruity raisin, light vanilla, very sweet and medium bitterness. Really nice!

Bottle at home, 29/08/16. Bought a couple of years ago, still BB 2021. Rich aroma - raisens, brown sugar, rum. Dark brown. Thin ring of a beige head. Medium sweet and bodied. Oily finish on the tongue with a burn from the alcohol at the back of the throat. Spices, raisens, something I cant pick out along the lines of almonds. Just been doing DIY so was going to have something lightet but had this at room temperature as nothing in the fridge. Very satisfying.
Brunrød farge med beige skum. Lukter av mørke stenfrukter og noe sødme. Smaker av sjokolade og kaffe. Noe søtt og salt i avslutningen.

A small taste from wiosna (bottle) @ Oak Barrel. Pours deep amber with a low head. Aroma is roasted malts, milk chocolate and some coffee. Flavor is roasted malts, chocolate, alcohol, coffee and hops. Good.
Copper colored. Toffee and caramel aromas, ripe fruits. Taste is caramel sweet, fruity, never too sweet. Dry finish with some wood.
Bottle 330ml. Dark brown with a reddish tint. Light offwhite head. Sweet bready aroma and caramel. Malty taste with more caramel and sweetness like molasses. Me like this.

2012 vintage.Visited Traquair house on my stay in Peebles just down the way back in 2006. The only beers of a long trip I never noted down. Good to have a few bottles ageing away now so into a chalice this one goes. At cellar temperature it settles out quickly with little head bar a film of tannish bubbles. The body a deep, russet brown and slightly hazy - unexpected for its well-kept age. Nose is musty and dominated by meaty umami and caramelised fruit mince, hints of date, spruce, damp wood, sherry, leather and sodden earth. On the palate it is vinous, rather tart and fruity whilst still thrusting forward a very earthy and complex malt profile. Light hint of roasted carob, tea leaves, musty oak barrels, grilled beef, leather and cocoa powder heightens its lack of sprightly carbonation. The body medium with the light berry-like acidity of the swallow matched by meaty malts give off a full finish and lasting presence in the olfactories. It is warming but this marries in well. A touch of smoke and charred berries builds giving it a gentle bitterness. A very well balanced, complex and yet restrained, and contemplative brew. A tribute to the house of Traquair. (33cL, BBE 12/20, Cellarbrations Carlisle)
Negro con reflejos rojizos y espuma beis. aromas de uva pasa, fruto seco, anís, bizcocho. Cuerpo medio-alto, sabor de uva pasa, avellana, final seco y largo.

From bottle to thistle glass. Pour is a dark copper color, thick tan head. Nose is malty, dark fruit, molasses, toffee, a bit of booze. Taste is sweet, light-medium bodied. Super smooth and crisp finish. Awesome Scottish ale
Mörkbrun med litet skum. Doftar och smakar karamellmalt, russin och lite kaffe. Lagom beska och fyllighet
@ Basunen 16-4-29: Väldig söt med toner av kaffe, karamell och socker. Klibbigt, sött men ganska gott.

Bottle from Beerlovers, Vienna. Pours reddish to brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, toffee and caramel. Taste of light roasted malt, sweet malt, caramel and dried fruits like plums. Medium body with a soft carbonation. Dry,malty finish with some bitterness too. Good one.

Color caoba con poca espuma. Aroma muy intenso y complejo lleno de frutas pasas, caramelo, notas de madera, levadura y algo de regaliz. En el trago no es tan densa como prometen el aroma y el volumen alcohólico, pero todas sus notas se ven ensalzadas y complementadas por un dulzor complejo y nada empalagoso. Sencillamente genial.

Dark ruby color with a fine off white head. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium + body and an average to soft carbonation. Oily texture. Dried fruits, toffee, dark malt and mild roasted.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]

Bottle from SB Orminge. Dark reddish brown with off white head that leaves a bit of lacing. Malty aroma with mostly marzipan and raisins. Taste is dry toffee with brown sugar and orange zest. Dryish finish with some woody notes.

Yeast, malt, alcohol and Mazarin in the fragrance. Malty, light ash coal and burnt taste. Okay bitterness that fills the mouth for a long time. A little too bitter for me. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

0.33l bottle. Deep ruby body, thin off-white head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, reisins and figs. Taste of figs, plums, chocolate, caramel and reisins. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. The finish has some bitterness too. Very nice.
A brown dark color. A lot of sirup caramel and a nose of coffee. The taste is long and despite the 7.2 in alcoholic there is almost no taste of it. Perfect balance

Bouteille. Nez malté de caramel toffee sucré (légèrement rôti et terreux, aux notes fumées) avec des notes de chocolat et de sucre brun, légèrement fruité (notes de raisins, de dates et traces de cassis) et avec des notes de houblon herbeux, dalcool très doux, de noix et boisées. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture crémeuse. Goût fruité légèrement boisé (dates, léger de raisins, traces de prunes et de cerises noires) avec de faibles notes de vanille et dépices (faibles notes de clou de girofle?) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté moyennement sucré et terreux de caramel toffee (présence de rôti-brûlé) avec un léger goût de chocolat noir puis vient enduite une moyenne amertume asséchante de houblon herbeux, dalcool très doux ainsi quun léger goût de fumée boisée et des notes de noix. Arrière-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux, de rôti, dalcool très doux avec des notes de noix, de fumée boisée et fruité (moût de raisins). [notes 2005]

amber-dark-brown color, mid-sized head, head disappears rather quickly.
sweet and malty taste & smell. 
low-mid carbonation
overall: decent ale. Id recommend it.
Bottle at home from Alesella dark brown Fruity sweet aroma flavour is plums boozy raisins soft Brown sugar Sweet treacle finish with strong alcohol presence

Deep amber/red with off white head. Strong aroma of marzipan and raisins. The taste is sweet with a light toasty touch with bitter finish. Good tasting beer. Medium to full body. Over all I find it a little artificial in its complexity. Had hoped for some more subtle complexity both in the aroma and the taste, since I loved the few other wee heavys Ive had (founders Backwoods Bastard e.g.)

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 17C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: prominent alcohol aroma mixed with moderate malt presence with toasty notes and mild dark caramel. medium-low presence of esters remembering dried plums and grapes. no hop discernible. no diacetyl. APPEARANCE: dark brown color and translucent. moderate-low dark ivory head with medium-low to loe retention. some leg formation. TASTE: malt flavor with notes similar to aroma with medium intensity (toasty, caramel). peppery alcohol present in balance with the malt. esters very faint of dark raisins and plums. low bitterness with a semi-sweet finish. no hop flavor discernible. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-low carbonation. alcohol warmth present but in moderate strength. OVERALL: a wee-heavy with a nice blend of aromas and flavors, with a present alcohol note. would benefit with a bit mode body, carbonation and caramel aroma.

330ml brown bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is clear mahogany brown with a medium sized frothy beige head that reduced quickly. Aroma of caramel, orange marmalade and toffee. Flavours of caramel, toffee, syrup loaf, brown sugar and orange peels. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full-medium bodied, slightly sticky texture and average carbonation. Overall a decent Scotch Ale.

Jam, marmalade, dried fruits, plums, figs, alcohol, earthy, grass, herbal.
Ruby colour, small tan head.
Rather sweet, medium bite, lightly salty. ABV well hidden.
Medium body, soft carbonation, sweetish finish.

Pours translucent brown with small head. Smell is very nice, malty. Taste is mild copper but smooth, palate is slightly pale for my taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appena la si stappa e prima ancora di versarla nel bicchiere, questa birra in stile scotch ale è esplosiva al naso, con tante note caramellate e di pane nero, di whisky e frutta secca (prugna), lievissime le note tostate. Il colore è mogano con bei riflessi aranciati e rubino, con una schiuma non abbondante di color beige e dalla consistenza cremosa, ottima anche la persistenza che accompagna tutta la bevuta. Il corpo è abbastanza strutturato, assai vellutato e dolciastro, con una carbonazione bassa ma con bollicine finissime. Al palato tanto caramello e frutta secca (prugna e albicocca), con sentori legnosi e di whisky. Buono il retrogusto ancora dolciastro e a tratti vinoso. La beva non è facile ma risulta assai calda e avvolgente.

Klar, mörkt läder brun, khaki färgat skum. Doft: Malt, lager, äpplen, frukt, frisk höstluften, skogsjord. Smak: Som doft. Lagringsbar i 10år enligt flaskan, och den här behöver några år på sig tror jag. Provade flaskan endast 4mån.

330 ml bottle at home. Reddish brown with thin off white head. Aroma is malty, bready and some burnt sugars. Taste is bready, burnt sugar, sweet malt, light hop profile with medium bitterness. Nicely balanced.

Appearance: dark-brown, clear, minimal head (I poured carefully). 
Aroma: caramel, coffee, dark bread.
Taste: coffe, dark bread, malty
Palete: medium to full body, soft carbonation and long finish
Overal: very drinkable Scotch Ale as it should be

Clear, dark mahogny colored beer with a beige, two finger high, head. 

Nose: Sweet caramel malt, dried fruit, plum, brown sugar and some tea. 
Taste: Again caramel malt, nuts, fudge, chocolate and bread. I get some Coca Cola here also! Strange... 
Mouthfeel: A bit light... Light carbonation. Medium to light body. A light bitterness at the end. 

Smooth and very drinkable!

Appearance: clear deep amber with a short dense light beige head, good retention and patchy lacing. (3/5) Aroma: dark malt, dried fruit, wood. (7/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, mild bitter. (7/10) Palate: medium-full slightly creamy body, soft carbonation, bittersweet finish. (4/5)

Another decent brew from Traquair house. Not overly sweet, and decent depth of flavour. These guys might be able to change my opinion on wee heavies (14/20)

From bottle. Pours a dark brown with a one-finger white head. Aroma and taste of caramel and malts. Taste has all the qualities of a Scotch ale, caramel and lovely. Nicely sweet, but not too much. Medium full mouthfeel. Nice bitter sweet finish.

Bottle at home thanks to ShivanDragon who gave this to me for Secret Sinterklaas. Dark brown almost black beer, small head. Aroma is malt, caramel, fruit, wood. Taste is the same quite sweet.. nice one.
Bottle, 33 cl. Decent ale, full aroma, warming. Pleasant finish and carbonation.
330ml bottle. Datk copper body with a low head. Chocolate, hint of peat, spices.
Flaska från SB. Mörkt brunröd med beige skum. Doft av bränd karamell. Smak av karamell, lite vanilj och brödig beska.
UPDATED: OCT 26, 2016 Overrated beer! Plain british ale, not bad or outstanding, just regular stuff really.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty smell with fruits and some meat broth. Similar taste with some caramel. The meat broth is slightly disturbing but besides that a nice beer.

330 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear mahogany with a compact solid tanned head, rich lacing. Malty sweet aroma, dark dried fruit, plum, oak barrels. Creamy mouthfeel, mildly carbonated. Earthy, woody and malty taste dried fruits, caramel, oak barrels. Warm and dry finish. Stylish!
Pours dark with a slight head. Aromas of light caramel and oats, with hints of currant.
@ Havregatan 151220. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity, roasted malty and caramely with dried fruits and sherry notes, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and fruity.

Mørk brun med rødskjær, to fingre høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter nøtter, mørke frukter og lett brent karamell. Middels fylde. Smaker bittert, kakaobønner, kaffe og bent karamell, noe salt. Den salte litt brente karamellen sitter igjen.
@ Agards väg 16/12-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty and dried fruity. Body is medium, the finish is dry with notes of dried fruits.

Pours dark brown with low off white head
Aromas of toffee, fudge, butterscotch, dark bready malts, dark fruits
Taste has notes of butterscotch, caramel, toffee, sweet fruityness, hints of dried fruits. Medium sweetness, no to low bitterness, low carbonation, warming mouthfeel

Rödbrun färg. Torkad frukt i doft. Fyllig smak med torkad frukt och malt. Lite stickig alkohol. Ok

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rund och något söt. Jag kan ana en viss skumbanan. Trevlig jul eller till brasan öl..
330 ml bottle from Systembolaget. hazy amber with off white head. Caramel, syrup, earthy, toast and toffee. Semi dry with medium bitterness and low to medium carbonation.

Pours clear brown with about two fingers of off-white / light tan head. Aroma of nuts, toffee, caramel, malts. Taste is sweet and roasty with light butterscotch note before a light citrusy finish. Light to medium bodied, smooth, with soft carbonation
Doft av katrinplommon. Frisk syrlig smak med viss knäckig smak och rostad malt. Stora kolsyrebubblor. Ganska tunn och vattnig.

Redan på William Wallaces tid hade skottarna förstånd att sätta sig upp mot överhögheter och lorder som försökte få det strävsamma folket att foga sig. Man visste även att ett stop öl passade sig i stort sett när som helst oavsett tid på dygnet och dag i veckan, och traditionsenliga som skottarna är har inte den vanan ändrats nämnvärt. I ljuset av det känns något så här attitydslöst och fogligt som ett skottskt misslyckande. Ett öl som dansar efter den vanliga väntade (säck)pipan är inget som kommer att få fäste i historieböckerna. Drucket i dag, glömt i morgon, känns inte som en nordbrittisk attityd.

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2015.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Vinous, caramel, malt, hops, dried fruit.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Vinous, dried fruit, alcohol, caamel.

A little watery. Not much of the expected Scottish flavor. ---Rated via BeerBuddy for iPhone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, best before June 2018. 
Metallic, old English malt character, could easily mistake malt profile as a doppelbock (optimator). Light brown malt with a chewy, nutty flavor. Low Co2. Nuttiness of boiled peanuts.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours dark chestnut brown, almost no head white. Aroma: sweetish, roast, toffee, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate. Taste is sweetish, slight smoke sourness, caramel, burnt wood, Medium body. Sweet-bitter finish.

Aroma is sweet malts, candy sugar and sweet cask oak. Taste is sweet malts and dark fruits with slight bitterness that dissipates. Smooth consideringvthe abv though. The full body does sadly taper off. Appearance is a clear amber with a thin pearl head that retains somewhat poorly.
Kurze Review von Untappd: Not as tasty as their Jacobite Ale, still quite smooth and easy drinkable.

Bottle from Willows Market in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma is sticky red bananas, dark cherries, cherry liqueur, herbal bitters / orange bitters, Old Fashioned. Taste is whiskey and coke, dark fruits (sugary cherries), something boozy and bourbon-y with herbal bitters. Reminded me very much of an Old Fashioned.
Mail order bottle. Clear maroon color, scant head. Aroma of plums, raisins, dates. Taste has lightly burnt espresso, dark fruit. Very tasty.

Backwoods Bastard is the only barrel aged Scotch Ale I have to compare Traquair House Ale to. Its a flattering comparison, yet both are so different from one another. Unlike Backwoods Bastard (or countless other barrel brews), Traquair House is medium-bodied and extremely smooth. Aroma is malty and rich with hints of syrup. Flavor has dark fruit, caramel, toasted malt, and a hint of smoke. Aging has given the beer some oak smells and tastes, but the influence is smartly subdued. Bout time I had a Scotch Ale from Scotland. Damn glad I started with this one.

Bottle.

A- Dark cherries, dark fruits, molasses, subtle vinegar.

A- Black color, black liquid, tan head.

T- Dark fruits, cherries, cocoa, malty, subtle booze, raisins, plums.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, slightly medicinal finish.

O- Finally a scotch ale from their homeland. Full of dark fruits and cherry and smooooooooth. A bit of a medicine tasting finish which hurt a little but still very tasty.
Some oak and basement musk. A hint of caramel and smoke. Pours dark brown with good head. Some bitterness in finish. Ok. Bottle from outlet liquors.
Dark red-brown color. Aroma of caramel, alcohol hints. Taste: warming, berries, light caramel, wine, rich & complex. Good beer.
16.9 oz bottle pours brown with a tan head. Aroma of fruit, caramel, and oak. Taste is toffee, plums, and coffee.

Bottle from Waiitrose in Edinburgh. Aroma is caramel/toffee and slight butterscotch. Hops are very subdued which helps the other flavours to shine. There are also slight stewed/dried fruit aromas like prunes and figs. 

Appearance is dark like maybe a porter. Not a huge amount of head which is off-white. 

Taste is medium-sweet. This is basically a classic Wee Heavy, and own of the last remaining real examples of the style. 

Body is medium, but feels quite viscous. Carbonation is medium. Im glad its not too strong as it doesnt suit this style. 

Overall, Im so glad to have found this classic. Ive tried Founders - Dirty Bastard, Oskar Blues - Old Chub, and Brewdog Dogma which all love, but its great to try a real old time classic of the style. Fantastic.

Bottle shared at the Tropical Croydonia tasting. 01/07/2015. Many thanks to Paul and JackL for these.

2011 vintage. Aroma is nice raisin dried fruits, figs nutty malts, some alcohol. Light caramel brown coloured pour with a thin tan head. Flavour is composed of woody, booze, dried fruit, jam, little tang, some sugars. Palate is light / medium body, little age, lowish carbonation. 7,3,7,3,14

1991 vintage. Aroma is woody, soy, jammy fruits. Flavour is more jammy and dried fruit. Boozy fruit cake. Better. 6,3,8,3,15

1985 vintage. Aroma holds more sherry note, little tart, nutty soy. Flavour is composed of jam, earthy wood, little musty wood. 6,3,7,3,13.

1977 vintage. More umami, soy. Rasisn and booze, tart berry, jammy fig. plum. Still some carbonation on this bottle.

0.33 l bottle from FIRMA BIER, bottled in august 2014 (one year old). Clear, dark red with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Sweetish-malty aroma of raisins, blackcurrant, plums, molasses and licorice. Sweetish-malty taste of molasses, cane sugar, licorice, raisins and blackcurrant, followed by a short, slightly bitter, coffeish finish. Medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel, average carbonation. Quite tasty but also not that interesting. Decent brew without any surprises.
dark beer, malts . liquorice, some dark fruits,strong boozy aftertaste, decent beer

Excellent ale. Dark amber-brown with creamy tan head. Aroma of malts and molasses. Taste adds caramel, roasted dark malts and the oak left a smoky-woody aroma. Low bitter ending. Smooth and easy to drink.

~Sweet bready, aroma. Hard to pinpoint what Im smelling. Oak, raisin,vanilla, coconut.
~Pours a dark amberish brown with small lasting creamy light tan head.
~Sweet flavor as well with some strong oak flavor and slight roast, earth hop character of wood and leaves.
~Medium bodied, medium co2, lingering bitter roastiness.
~Enjoyable beer, would love to enjoy with friends on a cool evening, but doesnt particularly stand out to me.

33cl bottle Dark brown colour with a small thin tan head. Caramel, dates, raisins and toffee in the aroma. Soft carbonation and full body. Taste is medium sweet at front with bitter notes coming forward. Overall, a very good beer.

Light brown with a frothy average head. Aromas of caramel, liquorice, sherry, alcohol. Sweet, with a tart and bitter touch, and an alcoholic finish. Soft carbonation and watery to oily mouthfeel. A bit cloying.

2011 vintage @ Croydonia. Deep reddish amber with a modest head. Red apple and cocoa. Rich malty punch. Taste of tobacco Infused liquorice. Toast. Brown bread and cocoa. Still pretty hot! Oily and soft. Decent.

Bottles shared in London - big thanks to Paul and Jack.Vintage 2011. Pours clear golden brown with a bubbly khaki head. The nose has lightly toasted bread, ripe fruits, fig, leather. Medium sweet flavor with lots of leathery fruits, earth, toasted grains, faint ash and cocoa. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with more toasty bread, faint metal, earth, toffee. Not bad. (3.6)Vintage 1991. Pours clear light brown with a slight, bubbly white head. A fair bit of oxidation in the nose, some caramel, leather. Medium sweet flavor with a bit of tobacco, rich figs, bread, mellow alcohol. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Lightly warming finish with lots more fig, date, bread. Certainly some age, but very nicely nuanced. (3.8)Vintage 1985. Pours clear brown, darker than the previous vintages, with a bubbly tan head. Nice aroma with rich burnt crackers, bread, toffee, faint cocoa. Light to medium sweet flavor with a bit of burnt pine, slight metal, burnt toast, grain, toffee. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Fairly bitter on the finish with more pine, earth, ashy cocoa, dried berry, so e beat-up leather. Pretty interesting. (3.6)Vintage 1977, batch 6. Pours clear, light brown with a few bubbles for a head. Mellow aroma, suggestions of bread and caramel, grain. Light sweet flavor with some tangy berries, earthy bitterness, oily fruits, bitter grain, caramel. Medium bodied, chewy, with soft carbonation. Finishes with bready malts, more caramel, some toffee, light berry, grain.  Not bad overall, especially given the age. (3.4)

Dark red-brown colour with a small beige light creamy head. Aromas of malts, bread, dried raisins, some caramelised nuts and fruity-herb notes develop. Lightly carbonated, slick texture with a full body. Fruity-malt sweetness up front with light woody notes to it and a light faint bitterness. Lasting finish. Pretty complex beer.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2015 Bottle, pours brown/black with an off white head. Aroma: burnt caramel, prunes, raisins, hint of peat, wood, herbs, earthy. Taste: burnt caramel, dark fruit, elderberries, some peat, molasses, bay leaf, herbs. Medium sweet, light-moderate bitter, oily texture, somewhat thin, medium body, soft carbonation. Sweet, slightly cloying finish.
Bottle from Boise Coop. Nice pour, initial airy head which subsides to a tight beige head. Heady aroma of malt and peat, taste moreso, with some added caramel. Earthy, cloying finish. Nice!
Bottle @ Tolkiens House, Zagreb. Color black with huge head. Aroma malt, fruits, toffee. Taste sweet, caramel, roasted, malt.

330 ml bottle from Birsciop. Dark copper/brown, hard to see through, with a small, bubbly and persistent light beige head. Poweful and intense nose, grapey and winey, burnt caramel and dark fruits reminiscence almost like a BSA, quite nutty and slightly boozy in the background. Oaky and almost woody taste upfront, mildly astringent and slightly tannic, not exactly easy to drink as there is pretty much no fizz whatsoever. Moderate warming sensation, herbal and almost medicinal aftertaste. Flat to soft carbonation, medium body, oily texture. Maybe its an unlucky bottle, maybe I just dont like scotch ales.

Bottle at Oak Barrel, Helsinki-V airport. Pours dark brown with a little head. The aroma features creamy fudge, vanilla, oak and caramel, gives an aged impression. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, very malty. Caramel, vanilla, bread and some dark fruitiness appear. The palate is medium bodied, fairly flat, a bit sticky. Nice flavours, could perhaps use a fuller body.

Il colore è bruno, quasi di corteccia, invitante e sontuoso, con riflessi rubino; la schiuma si presenta fine, ocra e persistente. Al naso si percepiscono nettamente note di miele di castagno, caramello, frutta secca e fave di cacao a cui fa capolino, col passare del tempo, una nota legnosa e di rabarbaro. Laroma è ben strutturato, elegante ed invita a una degustazione puntuale e rilassata. In bocca il corpo è medio e la carbonazione lieve, al gusto si distinguono nettamente note di cola, fave di cacao e frutta secca, contrappuntata da una leggera acidità abbastanza tipica in queste birre dai sapori tostati.
Il finale è rotondo ed offre una bella sensazione di persistenza caratterizzata da cacao amaro e liquirizia accompagnata da una piacevole sensazione di warming che rivela il grado alcolico (7.2%).

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear dar brown beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: roasted malt and chocolate domination. Small grapes finish and small sour notes. Very great nose ! Taste: nice roasted malt well balanced with sour finish and raisin. Notes of plums. Small chocolate finish. Aftertaste: bitterness and caramel.

Poured into a perfect pint.

3.25 A: Dark amber brown that is constantly changing color based on the amount and angles of light. One and a half fingers of frothy beige head. Retention is a bit below average and not much lacing is left.

4.75 S: The nose on this is incredible. I just had the Jacobite Ale not long ago and I can now smell what was under all that coriander. Powerful, yet supple peat and mineral. Molasses, caramel, and brown sugar. Oaken woodiness. Earthy and outdoorsy. Doesnt have the big, bold aromas of a lot of American brews, but it has the sophistication and integration of the Trappist brews. Really well done.

3.75 T: The taste is very good, but its only a tenth of pleasurable as the smell. Still, its a tasty brew. Peat and mineral. Oak and earthiness. Caramel, molasses, and brown sugar. It comes together well, but just not as well as the nose. Im picking up a big more tannic astringency than Id like as well.

3.5 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation. A bit of tannic astringency on finish. This could benefit from some more creaminess.

3.75 D: Overall its a pretty damn good brew. I didnt pick up any astringency in the Jacobite, so maybe this is just how this batch turned out.
Brown to dark brown colour, minimal head. Aroma is malty, with some caramel. Same in the taste, nice full body, sweetish, low bitterness, nice ale.
Great Scottish beer. Light in color and light in taste. This is a smooth look and night finish.
330 mL bottle. Clear dark brown pour, thin but fairly long lasting light brown head. Caramel aroma, some wood, light roast. Taste is semi sweet, vanilla, caramel, oak. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Bottle from Favourite Beer Cheltenham. Deep almost black colour with a tan head. Dried and spiced fruit aroma with a dark toffe sweetness. Taste also has the sweetness, with more dried fruit.
Bottle from a trade. Thanks minutemat! Dark brown, beige foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet with notes of cocoa, dark chocolate, caramel. Rather dry bitter finish. Well balanced. Good!
Smells like a light sweet cup of alacholic coffee. Clear brown color with lasting thin head. Malty but thinner then expected, turn a bit fruity rinsed to a light after taste. Really delicious.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear brown colored with an red glow. Quite bitter taste with hints of burned alcohol, toffee, caramel and dried fruit.
30.12.2014. Dark brown, head disappears immediately completely. Aroma of dried fruits, brown sugar sweetness, molasses, wood. Taste has dried fruits, wooden bitterness, molasses, slight ethanol.
0,33 bottle. Dark red color with beige head. Alcohol, caramel, plums and carob aroma. Alcohol, dark chocolate, coffee/espreso/toffee taste. Aroma is big plus of this beer. Nice one.
Awesome beer, lovely dark colour, tastes of dark fruits..................................
Pours a lovely maroon with off white head. Aromas of bubblegum, dark fruit, and vanilla. Nice balanced malts, bubblegum, dark fruits and a nice bitter finish. Great stuff.
Pours a clear reddish brown color. Aroma and taste are sweet caramel and some oak.

Bottle. Pours deep dark mahogany, with a creamy head. Aroma is nice roasted malts, with bread and toffee. Medium body with creamy texture, and soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet roasted malts with bread and toffee, with nuts and dark fruits, as well as some dry burned wood sticking through the finish.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 500 ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Looks: Clear, deep burgundy black colour; One-quarter finger head and soapy off-white beige foam which fades in 30 seconds; Pretty good sticky lacing and slight carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant Ale malt, with strong plums, strong caramel, strong toffee, cream, light vanilla, sugar and light straw. 

Taste: Medium sweet malt, with light metallic, strong caramel, strong sticky toffee, burnt toast, vanilla, fairly light plum, molasses, very light alcohol, strong wood barrels, lime, bitter hops and grass.

Body: Mid to light body, slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Full maltyness yet the body is light. Intense strong caramel and sticky toffee with burnt toast echoing. Wow! Light vanilla and dark fruits, molasses is appropriately light for such sweet nose, mixed with very strong barrel and nice liquorice-like hops. Beautifully rustic!

Hoppiness: Straw in nose. Lime, neat liquorice and grass in taste. Bitterness is fairly strong for a long lasting medium bitter-sweet sweet finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Toffee-ish and bitter sweet to mouth.

Comments: A very rustic Wee Heavy, with such strong toffee and malty character without being forced and showy. Every elements fall into place and works wonderfully. This is simply marvelous!
Flaska Bishops arms. Mörkbrun kulör med smutsvitt skum. Rostad doft med blöt kartong. Maltig smak med torra kaffetoner. Bra beska och klibbigt torr i gommen.

33cl bottle @ brauhaus, Edinburgh. Body is clear ruby brown, head is medium, beige, creamy, mostly lasting, good lacing. Nose is roasty liqueurish, aroma is chocolate, vanilla, herbs, spices, woody. Medium sweet, medium roasty bitter, light sourish alcohol flavor. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Tasty, easy dessert beer.

Large sample pour of dark burnt sugar color with plenty of sweet aroma. Loads of caramel throughout aroma and flavor. Almost an oaky smoke flavor it it in the finish. Faint hop notes, maybe, but that could be in my head...

Bottle kings head Huddersfield. Dark red thin head. Aroma is red fruits malts taste is lots of sweet treacle malts red fruits currants some coffee choc good long hoppy bitter finish. Nice smooth body slight carbonation. Good stuff.
Malty aroma. Good scottish malted taste without any smoked or toffy notes. Jacobitwe is more interesting IMO.

Toffee, vinegar, toejam, and oak smell, thankfully not strong. Clear chestnut brown, medium tan head. Oak and toffee. Finishes with charred oak. Medium body, cask-like softness. Excellent balance. I dont know what is going on with the aroma, but the beer tasted fine. Maybe it was my glass.

33cl bottle bb AUG2022. Drier than a DE Bock, more reticent than a BE strong ale, yet suavely in between, this Scotch "potent liquor": woody brown malts, earthy old raisins, aged caramels, with an understated Worcester sauce savoury complexity, made palatable by more treetrunk chtonics, cured vanilla wood and even some smokiness. Easy sipper.

Pullo @ Baltic Princess Pub. Kaatuu lasiin tumman mahonginruskeana ja hieman sameana, noin kahden sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on pähkinää ja paahdettua sokeria tai siirappisuutta, kuivattua hedelmää ja suklaata. Maussa on paljon tummaa hedelmää ja suklaata, pähkinäisyys ja mausteisuus on taustalla tukemassa. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen ja hieman makea, humalan puraisu on kevyttä. Hyvä old ale/english strong ale, mukavan tasapainoinen ja ei onneksi liian sokerinen.
Bottle. Good flavor, a nice rich flavor. A bit of honey and caramel. Very good.

Had this months ago. Lighter shade of dark brown, a bit of foam. Aroma is sweet, sticky, caramel, coca-cola. Quite nice, reveals some barleywine character. Taste is not so sweet, burnt sugar, caramel, dryly sweet without excess sweetness. Aftertaste is dry. Remind me upgraded version of Innis & Gunn. Definitely Scottish. Slow drinker but has actually some good drinkability.

Barley wine. Seems not to be bottle conditioned, which doesnt help this beer (or any ale). Alcohol in the nose, Molasses and roasted flavours and alcohol flavour. Nice, but not as good as I was expecting.

Appearance: Deep burgundy, clear, with almost no foam head. 
Aroma: Caramel, toffee, and a slight woodiness. Nothing stands out. 
Taste: Rich malty sweetness with flavors of bread crust, caramel, and molasses. A definite roastiness stands out on the backside, which wasnt noticeable in the aroma. 
Mouthfeel: Medium with a light carbonation, and a hint of alcohol warmth. 
Finish: Malt forward with a lingering roast. 
Overall: A showcase of rich malt without some of the smokiness found in other examples. Its fermented in oak, but I didnt pick up any vanilla, and only a minimal toast or chocolate flavor.

Really old backlog rating. 33cl bottle from A Tutta Birra, Milano. It pours a brown color with ruby edges and a medium beige head. Aroma is sweet, fruity, boozy, rich, sticky, with vanilla, molasses, persimmon, maramalde. Taste is slightly smoky, fruity, malty. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, sweet but delicious

Bottle. Pours a intense ruby red with big creamy beige head. Aroma is sweet and very malty and lot of dried fritid. Burnt figs and raisins. Portish. Taste is toasty nuts and bit portish with rather thin body. Slight dry finish. Bad aftertaste with booze. Think its too old or stores bad.
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown, nose is nutty, chocolate, taste is similar, toffee.
Sample at Strong Ale Festival 2014. Comes dark reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma of malt, fruit, and yeast. Taste is malt, fruit, caramel, and yeast. Nice.

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie. Pours a deep dark brown with minimal off-white head. Aroma is cocoa. Taste is fruit cake, chocolate, caramel and malts, very smooth with no single element over-powering. Lovely stuff.

Reddish brown colour, beige head. Aroma of caramel, quite sweet nose. Banana flavour, belgian yeast, malts, brown sugar. Finish yeast, banana, caramel, cloying sweet. Feels quite like a sweet Belgian Style Ale.(From 33cL bottle shared @ The Autumn Gathering Formerly Known as RBBAG (I) Mons, Gent 2014)

25/X/14 - 33cl bottle @ The Autumn Gathering formerly known as RBBAG Mons (Gent) - BB: VIII/2022 (2014-1265) Thanks to Martinus for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark purple brown beer, small irregular beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: caramel, dried fruits, very malty, hay, cow fodder, bit sweet. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: hoppy, bit of citrus, caramel, bitter, dark chocolate. Aftertaste: some chocolate, bitter hops, pretty watery, spicy, coriander notes. Meh, no idea what all the craze is about. :(

Bottle. Pours a mostly clear darker brown color with a moderate light brown head on there. Nose has some caramel and a bit of yeast, and hints of wood to it. Taste is only slightly sweet with a bit of nutty caramel, and feels extremely smooth. Decent brew.
Bue en bouteille. Encore meilleur que sa petite soeur. Peu de mousse, peu de CO2. Arômes de whisky, de bois fumé. Excellente.

Dark brown/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, caramel/toffee, & some fruit; Flavor of slight roasted sweet malt, caramel, toffee, fruit, and some vanilla; Nicely balanced; Good brew.

Gorgeous dark red colour. Aroma is boozey rich, very nice. Gorgeous lacing. Lovely ale for the winter months. Caramel, molasses, hay, resin, alcohol, vanilla. A strong ale, thats what it taste like.

33cl bottle poured in a Trappist glass. Pours a very translucent dark amber colour with minimal head and a few bubbles of carbonation. Mouthfeel is flat and watery. Aroma is subdued however, hints at a malt dominated brew. Taste is the same as the aroma with toffee and spicy notes join the malt domination. Very average.
Oak aged, must have been scotch barrels, because the single-malt scotch flavor is up front. Very nice - sweet, low carbonation, very good stuff.
Bottle->SA. Medium brown with big frothy lite tan head. A: sweet and roasted malts. T: same, with nice lingering bittersweet aftertaste (more sweet than bitter). Nutty and malty. Nice.

Thank you Martinus! Tasting glass from 330 ml. bottle consumed @ The Tasting formerly known as Mons RBBAG I (2014). BBF 08/2022  seriously dude? Copper red with egg white head. Nose is herbal, syrupy, sweet herbal with lots of sugar, profile is quite Belgian. Taste is lightly bitter herbal upfront followed by strong sweetness, Belgian, cough syrup, thick candy sugar,..; Oily herbal body; I have the same reservations here as I had with Traquair Jacobite Ale, this tastes like an okay Belgian & yet the scores are through the roof, Im concussed here, is it because it was made outside of Belgium or what?
Drank from a bottle at a bar. Nice, strong and slightly sweet taste. Quite a good beer.

Bottle from Great Grog. Pours a murky brown with a thin head. Soft caramel notes and maybe a banana scent too on the nose. Tastes sweet, vanilla, caramel, sweet dark berries. Slow and warming finish. Very good beer

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 330ml bottle served in a tulip glass.
A: Pours a dark amber to brown color forming a thin but persistent white to yellow head. Few lacings left in he glass
S: Mainly sweet and roasted. Notes of toffee, dark chocolate, caramel malts, dark fruit esters, mainly raisins. Sweet grains 
T: Rich taste. Again, a sweet toffee and roasted upfront with notes of dark chocolate, dark fruits, wood, burned toffee. Excellent rosted bitterness
M: Medium bodied. Molasses. Medium to low carbonation. Toffee and roasted bitterness in the aftertaste
O: Great drinkability. Complex. Great Scottish Ale
[ BA Review @ 8/15/2012 ]

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bue en bouteille de 50cl au Sherwood Pub (Nicorvo), couleur brune, belle mousse, effervescence moyenne, une bière avec un goût très maltée sur caramel, le grillé et le fumé. Fin de bouche amère sur lartichaut très agréable.

500ml bottle into a nonic.

Pours an opaque very dark brown, nearly pitch black, with a one finger medium tan head. Pretty good head retention but the lacing is lacking.

Aroma is full of toffee and caramel with some hints of sherry. Touches of oak along with dark fruits and some smoke poking through.

The flavor is very heavy on the figs and plums with more of the sherries note present in the aroma. Some burnt toffee and smokey notes in the background but the flavor is overwhelmingly fruity. It works in this case, though. Some woody notes in the background but they are very restrained. Subtle sweet mouthfeel with a bit of lingering stickiness.

Overall, a very good scotch ale and more fruity than many of the other ones I have had. Great interplay between the wood, smoke, and fruit and well balanced. A great beer.

Bottle 33cl. Deep but clear chestnut brown, one finger frothy tan head, recedes after a while to a thin layer that lasts, minor lacing; aroma sweet roasted malts, brown sugar, caramel, licorice, raisins, coffee notes; taste mild sweetbitter, roasted caramel notes; full body, creamy texture and mouthfeel, average carbonation; lingering mild roasty bittersweet finish with toffee and woody undertones. Very well-balanced, I like its creaminess.
0.33l bottle. Dark brown color with small brown fast disappearing head. Aroma of caramel and coffee. Finish is nice coffee, little bitterness. Classy beer.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2015 First encountered as an 18-year old vintage at the Kulminator; tasted fresh a few years later. A very classic and famous Scotch wee heavy with complex fruity and malty aroma, coffee, orange, walnuts, calvados, vanilla; sweet malty taste, dried fruits, citrus peel, mellow but thinnish mouthfeel probably as a result of the long ageing, roasted bitterness in the finish. A great experience this was, now lets purchase a young one for comparison...

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Tasted on 3/14/2014. Got it for $7.27 a bottle. This ale seems dark for a Scottish ale being slightly amber but mostly dark brown. A robust flavor followed by a slightly sour finish. I can tell it?s aged in oak, but not smokey or whiskeyish.

BBD June 18. Dark amber pour with a deep dark ruby cast. Exceptional head, lacing and retention. Rich nose of dark fruit and malt - figs, raisins and plums against a rich malt sweetness. The body is heavy medium with a nice slick, almost creamy, texture. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence on the finish. The flavor profile is complex and well balanced. While not as intense as Jacobite, it follows the nose as well. The dark fruits flow into a light hop bitterness over a slightly sweet dark malt background. The smooth finish leaves a bit of lingering oak.

(Traquair House Ale) Bottle 330 ml at home, poured into a snifter. BB 2023. ABV 7.2%
Deep brown red colour on the body, one finger of thin tan head sitting on top. Average retention, it leaves light lacing around the glass after it has collapsed and with every swirl of the glass.
Aroma of caramel, red fruits, light vanilla, some wood even, hints of alcohol. Taste follows the aroma, caramel, light vanilla, slightly nutty, red stewed fruits, mildly sweet all in all, some roast character too. Very good. Faint bitterness on the aftertaste.
Medium thin body, Id like it a bit thicker. Good carbonation though. Slightly sticky palate.
Nice, tasty beer.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Dark brown color with a nice dark red glare coming through, medium to full sized beige head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is quite faint, dont get much really. Taste is malts, a bit thin, lightly a hint of roastyness, a hint of raisins and dark fruits, lightly bitter. Decent body, medium carbonation.

Bottle, pours brown with a thin khaki head, has a light caramel aroma, taste is sweet caramel with some dark fruit and hints of chocolate, yeast, and vanilla, light bitter dry finish, alcohol is subtle, nice beer
Bottle @benzai. Dark brown color with a off-white head. Smells roasty, malts. Tastes watery, roasty, malts, iron, dark fruits.

Bottle @ benzai. Dark amber colour, small off-white head. Smells sweetish, malts, some herbs.. Not a lot of smell. Tastes sweetish, slightly iron/rust, malts, hint of caramel. Not bad. Medium body, aoft carbo.

330 ml bottle. BBE Aug/22. Ukkometso, Tampere, Finland. 
Dark ruby red colour with a tiny off-white head. 
Berries, malt, sweetness, mild hops and mild alcohol in the aroma. 
The flavour is sweet malt, alcohol, berries, mild bitterness and mild vinous elements. Smooth and rich. 7.2% kicks slightly in after couple of sips. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sweet smelling molasses and toffee. Pours a dark ruby color with good head. Good carbonation. Rather sweet tasting, somewhat over powering for me. Overall, a rather Scottish beer that is a bit too sweet.

Couleur ambrée brune, légère mousse blanche. Bon nez malté caramel, note douce sucré, sucre dorge. Gout de fruits noirs (raisin sec, prunes), malté caramel (un peu grillé et sucré). Bonne petite amertume en fin de bouche. Bien douce en bouche.

Way to estery and vegemity for me to fully appreciate, though this did come towards the end of a tasting. Along with the aforementioned flavours included dark fruits, some nuts and chocolate. Will likely need to revisit, though it will have its work cut out to impress, based on this outing.

Cola colored scotch ale with a good foam. Fine malty aroma. The flavor of caramel and malt strength of the alcohol.
Slightly bitter spicy taste, a bit too strong

This was poured into a thistle glass. The side of the bottle says "best before June 2018."
The appearance was a really dark red close to a hazed over dark brown of sorts kind of color. The head was about one fingers worth of white foaminess that must have maintained itself for at least a good three minutes before it gently concaved into the body. The lacing was semi-thick and broadened itself all around the glass.
The smell had a strong sweet peatiness overpowering some light roasted caramel notes with a sweet nuttiness underneath. Also, theres a nice light vanilla and dark fruits really underneath.
The taste was mainly the sweet caramel notes and a touch of the nuts come back through some woody notes (assuming the oak barrels it was aged in). The aftertaste and finish are dry and sweet leading with the caramel notes.
On the palate, this one sat right at a medium on the body with a slight sessionability to it. The carbonation was extremely subdued but thats okay as the peat helps to maintain the stability of this beer.
Overall, this was a wonderful offering by Traquair for the style and for me.

Dark brown, almost opaque.
Aroma has nut, caramel, malt.
Flavor is little roasted, malty.

Splendida birra, dal sapore pieno e ricco. Già laroma mostra una birra di gran classe, caratterizzata dal sapore dolce. Ai bocca si sente il marzapane, ma anche un leggerissimo acidulo e un tocco di amarognolo nel retrogusto. Personalmente, però, sempre in casa Traquair, preferisco la Jacobite ale.

Chestnut brown, little head. Aroma of strong malt and caramel, with hint of liquorice and trace of soy sauce. Similar taste, like an earthy cola with a bitter finish. Medium bodied, slightly oily with low carbonation.
Got the classic sweet malt aroma, and cola flavour of a scotch ale, good example of its class, but not my favourite brew style.

Mainly available filtered in bottles, though part of the production goes unfiltered into cask. The traditional brewing process used in the production of Traquair House Ale consists of the following; 1. Traditional infusion mashing process. The wort is then drawn off and boiled during which process the hops are added. 2. The wort is now cooled and pitched with top fermenting yeast under controlled temperature. It is then fermented in oak over a period of seven days. The beer is then transferred into cold storage tanks or barrels and matured over a period of weeks. After maturation the beer is filtered prior to packing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tasted at Craftissimo. Quite light and drinkable for a scotch ale. Malt, dried fruit, slight oak. Very smooth palate.
Tasting at Craftissimo. Very classic scotch ale. Sweet, malty, quite nutty. Not bad and not too heavy.

Bottled. Pours deep amber with an average, off-white head. Roma of over ripe fruits, citrus notes, spice and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry, with a hint of bitterness and notes of alcohol. A very nice Ale.

Appearance: Clear dark brown with ruby highlights and thin beige head.
Aroma: Woody, musky, earthy, note of liquorice, light treacle and prune.
Taste: Low/medium sweetness and sourness with low bitterness.
Palate: Thick coarse texture, medium body, low/average carbonation, lingering dry, treacle like, vanilla, dried fruit finish.
Comments: Very good.

Bottle from Au Grain DOrge - Brown color with a small but persistent beige head, small lacing- Aroma is malty, caramel, biscuit, dried fruitts, hints of plum and roasted malt - Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, biscuit, earthy bitterness - Medium body, sweet, light/medium bitterness, caramel finish - impressive beer, perfect with cheese
Dark ruby color, off-white head. Medium body. Lots of malt in the aroma and palate. Notes of plums and raisins.
Malty, a little sweet. Not much hops. It seemed unbalanced to me and somewhat bland.
Dark brown pour with a beige head, toffee nose, bitter taste, dried fruits, herbs. Overall very smooth and enjoyable brew.
Dark reddish brown, almost like cola, off white fine head. Nice aroma of malts, caramel, plums, raisins and some alcohol. Similar taste, good light bitter finish.

Hints of plum and chocolate with a scent reminiscent of scotch makes this a sipping beer to behold.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A deep brown with some ruby highlights and smattering of khaki head. Smells of plum, raisin, oak, brown sugar. Taste is sweet maltiness with dark fruit, vanilla, prune, raisin, alcohol is subtle. Very little bitter, brown sugar, caramel. An enjoyable malty beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Backlog. Bottle at Green Lion Inn. Dominated by caramel, honey, herbs and dried fruits.
Tried during CMU Scotch Ale Tasting. Aromas of toffee, honey, alcohol and dark fruits. Sweet taste with a bit of a harsh finish. Medium body and medium high carb.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Murky brown with white ring. Vinous, date honey aroma, a little sweet, a little bitter and a little, non-offensive, alcoholic taste. Soft-to-no carbonation, vinous finish. Good.

Cervesa fosca amb presència descuma, molt acaramelada.
Cerveza oscura con presencia de espuma, muy acaramelada.

Bouteille de 330 ml achetée dans une SAQ. Dégustée le 30 juin 2003. Bière brune. Mousse très peu, pas de formation de col. Très très peu effervescente. Arôme de "barley wine". Goût de café marqué, très amère en finale. Gagnerait à avoir un peu plus deffervescence. Bien équilibrée, pas trop sucrée, alcool ne ressort pas trop.

33 cl bottle. Dark color, burgundy with a big creamy nutty head. Aroma is toasted malts, earthy, woody, nuts. Theres a liquory leftover, with dark chocolate and bittering hops. Taste is balanced, finish is bitter. Creamy texture, medium body, good.
3/20/2010. From bottle. Cloudy light brown with a tan head. Caramel aromas with hints of oak. Creamy mouthfeel, caramel and malt flavors with some sweet flavors on the finish.
Pours dark caramel with a pronounced head. Smells sweet and malty. Sweet on the palate with a smooth finish. Creamy mouth feel makes this an easy drinking. Quite nice
Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks. Pours hazy brown with a beige head, aroma of caramel, bread, cookies, flavor of caramel, bread, acidic, medium bodied.
This is a richly balanced ale. With notes of toffee, caramel, raisins and banana bread being complimented with light woodsy tannins and earthy, almost dusty, hop bitterness.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein rötlichbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, süß, würzig, nussig, Karamell. Geschmack röstmalzig süß, nussig, Karamell, Gewürze.

Bottle shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Clear reddish brown, brown head. Nose is sweet caramel, raisins, toasty malt. Flavour is bready-malty sweetness, hints of wood and licorice. Dry finish. Good balance.
0,33L bottle, BB 08.2022. Pours brown without head. Aroma is burst of caramel with hints of alcohol. Taste is intense caramel, sweetness, malt dark fruits, and roast. Overall: nice one.

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines, Dalry. Pours clear red-brown, thin white head just sustained with gentle carbonation. Aromas of burnt sugar and spice. Taste brings vanilla, quite sweet, but not overly so. Light bitter at the end. Good.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2015 Clear dark brown color, small tan head. Aroma of oak barrel, caramel, chocolate liquor. Some scotch. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very good. 
(Vrutak 0,33l bottle)
Clear brown color, thin tan head. Medium body, soft carbonation. Aroma is caramel, dark fruits, dark chocolate. Medium sweet taste with dry finish. I loved it.
ok ok. strong ale nice bitterness that comes after the first sweet malty-caramel taste
(bottle 14/03-2014) medium beige head, clear dark red brown color, rather smooth complex taste, balanced wood taste, soft co2, fit body. BB date aug 22.

Doskonale piwo. Miedziano czerwone w odcieniu ze srednia piana ale znaczaca slady na kufelku. Tradycyjne piwo w smaku. Karmelowe lekki posmak toffi. Figowy aromat. Intensywny. Tradycja i doswiadczenie starego browaru to sama klasa w sobie.

Aroma: massive caramel malts, banana. Appearance: dark brown/black, small beige creamy head.Taste: medium to heavy sweet. Palate: sweets continue, dark ripe berries, dried fruits, low carbonation. Overall: big fan of this Scotch Ale, both massive aroma and complex palate, extremely enjoyable. Bottle from Beer Hawk, England.

Poured from a bottle into a dimpled mug, dark brown with reddish hints, the aroma is malt and a little oak, some smoky flavor with mild tang and some bitterness, the feel is thin and nice wamth at the end.

Pours dark caramel with a pronounced head. Smells sweet and malty. Taste great! Sweet on the palate with a smooth finish. Creamy mouth feel makes this an easy drinking wee-heavy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 08/2022. Pours clear dark amber in color with a nice creamy tan head. Really mild aroma with some dark malts and faint hints of toffee. Malty taste, some salty licorice and perhaps dark fruityness too is present. Feels a bit light at first, but somehow steps up and gets better towards the finish. Behind the salty licorice theres some vague smokyness and bitter chocolate in aftertaste.

Bottle from Vino Wines. Hazy dark brown body with a medium off-white head. Lively carbonation. Nice lacing. Mild aroma of red apple, grass, toffee and wood. Flavour of liquorice, raisin and leather. Tastes a bit like a Belgian Dubbel, and much lighter than its 7.2% ABV. Thin body with an oily mouthfeel. Fizzy carbonation. Quite an unusual beer, and more subtle than I was expecting.

500ml bottle - pours a reddish brown with a tan head. Figs, cocoa, toasted grain, anise for aroma. Flavor starts carmel toffee sweet with black licorice and light bitter chocolate notes in the finish. Traquair House Ale is a fantastic scotch ale.

500 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 6/2018. Pours fairly crystal clear dark reddish brown color with a 2 finger dense light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big raisin, plum, pear, apple, molasses, toast, toffee, brown sugar, brown bread, oak, light vanilla, light clove, herbal, floral, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/bready malt and fruity yeast ester notes with moderate oak presence;and good strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, pear, apple, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, molasses, toffee, oak, light clove, light vanilla, herbal, floral, and yeast earthiness. Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering flavors of raisin, plum, pear, apple, toast, brown sugar, brown bread, molasses, toffee, oak, light clove, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice balance, robustness, and complexity of dark/bready malt and fruity yeast flavors with light-moderate oak presence; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a smooth and lightly slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome scotch ale! All around great balance and complexity of dark/bready malt and fruity yeast ester flavors with light-moderate oak presence; and very smooth to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle from the Hogs Back Brewery shop. Pours deep chestnut with a small cream head. Taste is quite vinous and spicy with notes of raisin, coffee, evident alcohol and a finish that is a little woody and smokey. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 (from Fall 2010 notes; revised with a 330 ml bottle in Scotland in August 2015)

A - dark, slightly reddish, amber

S. slightly smokey, but less so than many Scottish ales. 

M - a bit lighter than suggested by the appearance. 

Tasty, interesting, and highly drinkable. 

This is a malt bomb with exceptionally well hidden alcohol. Outstanding! A must try ale from a small Scottish brewery.

Pours dark reddish brown with medium brown head. Aroma is dark fruit, oak, vanilla and a hint of dark chocolate. Taste is sweet with some creeping bitters. Medium bodied, easy to drink with alcohol well hidden.

Bottiglia. Al naso una bella nota caramellata, non eccessiva ma molto elegante. Bel colore, discreta carbonatazione; in bocca fantastiche sensazioni di prugna, frutta rossa sciroppata, vinosità appena accennata. Chiude bella morbida anche se a mio giudizio perde un pò se tenuta nel bicchiere, va gustata in fretta.
Bottle at Scout pub, Samobor. Actually was a bit disappointed with this one, didnt like sweet malty taste.

330ml bottle @L´Europe, Madrid, 2010. Pours hazy dark copper with nice off white head. Poor head retention, some lacing. Malty, spicy, caramel, some roasty aromas. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is caramel, wood, roasty, ripe fruit, some berries. Alcohol noticeable. Quite enjoyable.
Strong and thick, but surprisingly drinkable for its greasiness, from flavour to aftertaste goes from roasted to licorice, and a pack-a-punch and fizzy aroma

Small bottle. Dark copper body. Medium tall creamy head. Aroma has toffee, prunes, some rum. Similar to Jacobite. Taste is also similar to Jacobite - sweet raisin chocolate with some rum. Rich and oily mouthfeel. Finish has some oak. Very good, but Jacobite Ale wins by a small margin.

A dark brown head with an almost medium and beige head. The nose of toffeeish malts, dried fruits, some sweet berries and dry wood. Taste is dryer than aroma, dark bread, dry and wooden bitterness, some herbs and dried fruits. Medium bodied but feels slightly too light, smooth and low carbonation. The great aroma but otherwise slightly dull. Not bad but I expected more.

Ar: Deep vinous notes, brown sugar, some sherry oxidation.
Ap: Clear chestnut brown - small off-white head with moderate retention, leaves a ring of foam and a haze of lacing.
T: Treacle and lean dark fruits, low fruitiness - caramel, sherry, toasted malt - low bitterness, mossy - hints of coffee and chocolate.
P: Medium-bodied - medium-low carbonation, finish is dry.
O: Nice wee heavy - some well-aged flavors, dark fruits, and burnt sugars.

Bouteille 33cl BB 08/2022.
Cuivrée-ambrée, col blanc cassé.
Arôme est fruité noir, malt pâle, caramel sur un léger bouquet mélasse. Le tout reste très caractéristique anglais. Pointe houblonnée arrive en rétro-nasal offrant une touche citronnée.
Palais est ici très anglais, et tant mieux. De belles notes fruitées noires se font présente oscillant entre prune et raisin sec. Notes maltées de caramel, léger sucre brun, biscuité et ce côté mélasse. Amertume arrive quant à elle en fin de bouche.
On reste ici dans une tradition bien anglaise, le tout superbement bien exécuté et sans doute, avec lage, le profil fruité noir et caramel ne pourra que samplifier.

Ruby red, tiny yellow head. Aroma: toasty, lots of malt, some prunes, some decent hoppiness too and nutmeg. Flavour: sweet and malty, lots of bitterness and hoppiness with caramel and a sticky mouthfeel, long raisin finish. Nice.

330ml bottle. Clear dark copper color. Small size, brownish color head, stays. Not much of aroma. Mild roast, sweet, hint of berries, plum liquor, earthy taste. Very easy to drink. Bit too thin and emotionless. As it warms up whole another beer. Breadiness comes out and caramels too. Gave it upgrade.
Bière noire assez simple mais bien faite, caramélisée, café, qui se boit assez facilement.

Botella de 33 cl en el Lupulo. Varias veces durante 2012. Buena con cuerpo medio y espuma algo oscura presenta sabores especiados algo dulces y maltosos con un amargor final contenido. Toques hervaceos salvajes, alcohol bastante notable e integrado. Hay que repetirla.
---me traduzco la info para disponer la próxima vez que me la tome---
Principalmente disponible filtrada en botellas, aunque parte de la producción se destina no filtrado en barrica.
El proceso de elaboración de la cerveza tradicional utilizado en la producción de Traquair House Ale consiste en lo siguiente; 1. Tradicional proceso de maceración infusión. El mosto se extrae y luego se apaga y se hierve durante cuyo proceso se añaden los lúpulos. 2. El mosto se enfría y ahora lanzó con alta fermentación de levadura bajo condiciones de temperatura controlada. Se fermenta en roble durante un período de siete días. La cerveza se transfirió entonces a tanques de almacenamiento frío o barriles y madurado durante un período de semanas. Después de la maduración de la cerveza se filtra antes de su envasado.

Hmm, not quite as sweet as American Scotchs. It has a great deep dark pour with a thin white head that leaves nice lacing. The aroma is slightly faint with a hint of malt. The taste is also subdued. Its clean and well balanced but theres no real flavor explosion here. Its decent but not exactly what I was hoping for!

donker rood/bruin helder met schuimige kraki kraag
aroma: zoetige caramouten, smaken: matig tot redelijk zoet, matig bitter, normale sterkte, licht fruitig, redelijk caramoutig
medium body, glad van textuur, laag co2, afdronk kruidig en zoetig,
volle karamel moutig smaak, mooi pittig kruidig, goed spul !

Rating from 2008: Die Flasche sieht sehr edel aus; gefunden hab ich es bei Maruhn in Darmstadt. Haltbar bis 2016! Das Bier im Glas ist schön dunkelbraun mit rötlichem Ton. Der Geruch ist vollmundig-süß, malzig und geht schon in Richtung Rotwein. Der Antrunk ist im ersten Moment neutral, aber schon nach nicht ganz einer Sekunde wird ein fruchtig-vollmundiges Aroma freigesetzt. Trotz den 7,2% ist das Bier äußerst süffig, im Hauptteil stehen fruchtig-schokoladige Aromen im Vordergrund. Ich schmecke Trockenpflaume, dunkle Kirsche, Rosinen. Dazu ein schönes Espresso-Schokoladenaroma. Der Nachgeschmack ist mittellang, angenehm röstmalzig-dezent süß und gar nicht herb. Auf der Zunge verbleibt eine trocken-leicht süße Röstmalznote!  
--> Sehr leckeres Spitzenbier! Probierenswert! --> 13+13+12+13 = 12,75
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~

Appearnace was clear reddish black with diminishing creamy beige 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are caramelized roasty malts then deep fruits come out to play with smooth clean English yeast nose. No alcohol yet. Taste was fruits of plum, raisin, date, cherry then the slight woody toffee malts, mild alcohol present. Palate was soft creamy smooth CO2 with medium-full body, then lasting fruity woody balanced finish. A good solid wee heavy.

Bottle shared on the train from Inverness to Plockton, from Tomlinsons, 19/10/13.
Chestnut brown with reddish hues and a moderate light tan covering.
Nose is dark fruit, figgy jam, sherry notes, woody tones, fruit loaf, brown sugars.
Taste packs a little boozey vein, caramelised muscavado sugars, Xmas cake, dates, prunes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweet finale with a little lacing of booze.
Ok stuff, drinkable and lightly warming.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Geruch dunkelmalzig, schokoladig, röstig, fruchtig, Waldbeeren. Süßlich-malziger Beginn. Mitte bitterschokoladig, malzig-röstig, weinartig, Holzfaß. Abgang malzbitter, Röstnoten. Gutes Bier.

Bottled 0,33L. Dark brown color, deep and solid aspect with an elegant clear nut head of long resistance. Liquor and alcoholic nose, complex and equilibrate nose, notes of smoked wood, cortex, barley and marsala. Pleasant equilibrate mouth, little smooth palate with a long and perfumed final.

FROM NOTES: July 1, 12
330ml bottle poured into a tulip with my buddy in Napa, CA. 

A: Caramel malts strong on the nose, with molasses notes, and maybe some figs and/or dates. I can taste the alcohol, but it doesnt feel out of place, and sort of compliments the dark malty profile. An inviting aroma that fits the style well, it warms to reveal some nutty tones, along with toffee and subtle woodsy notes. 
A: Pours a dark brown with ruby highlights and a small head that dissipates fairly quickly. Not a ton of lacing, but it does gives some nice legs with each sip, coating the glass in suds. 
T: This is a very robust malty flavored beer. A dark caramel malt base is the backbone for a variety of flavorful notes to come through. Dark fruits, (figs and/or dates) and just a touch of black cherries can be identified. Alcohol warmth and a molasses taste give it some hearty weight. Hazelnut and hints of toffee and maple add to the sweeter side, and oak and peat provide some delicious earthy tones. Finishes with just the right amount of alcohol heat, along mild bitterness and cocoa. Truly a well crafted flavor profile, and a damn drinkable beer. 
P: Smooth and creamy. Low carbonation, with a medium-to-heavy weight to the body. Slight warmth in the finish with mild lingering bitterness. 
O: A dark, complex, and flavorful beer. As a major fan of the style, I consider this the standard by which all others are measured. DELICIOUS!!!

Pours a clear deep brown, with ruby highlights, a nice creamy half inch of off white head that slowly shrinks though stays full, dense and with good legs. Aroma is rich maltiness, caramel, earthy, peaty, oak, some dark fruity esters and light alcohol. Flavour is caramelized sugars, rich maltiness, oak, vanilla, nutty, earthy, a touch of alcohol, roasted malts, chocolate, raisins and plum esters. Absolutely loving this beer.

Bottle from Corral. Clear dark brown with amber highlights. A thick one finger head. A sweet aroma of dark fruit with brown sugar and oak. Complex fruit is tasted along with a slow growing sour bitterness. Raisins. This is like a fruit cake in liquid form. It is so complex. Some chocolate is a surprise but this beer has a few of those. Toffee. Just a bit of alcohol warming and some chemical flavor.

Earthy fruit bread, black cherry and woody booze aroma. Medium brown color, thick looking. Very sweet flavor, mild bitterness, surprise dryness. Plenty of toffee, yet it seems to me more a Belgian brown winter offering. Not heavy, has aftertaste and feel of black iced coffee. Pretty substantial for moderate strength.

Poured from a bottle it is a reddish brown ale with a slight cream
Color head. The aroma is of mocha and a hint of cherry the taste seems unusual with a netaluc taste That resonates bitter on the palate

From an imperial pint bottle shared in Avon NC. Pours a clear dark cola with a thick tan head. Aroma of light chocolate notes. Flavors of cocoa and toffee. Smooth mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Crisp, mildly bitter finish.

Bernstein/braun, leicht alkoholig im aroma, süsslich malziger antrunk, feinherb im abgang, nachklang leicht klebrig und bittere, mässige rezenz

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown pour. Earthy, breadlike on the nose with a bit of fruit. Malty toffee flavors with discernible warming alcohols and medium-low carbonation. Very nice.

Dark ruby red pour with a thick beige head which dissipates. Malt, bread, berries, booze, caramel, vinous, pepper, dank. Slightly dry with medium carbonation. The flavours and aromas are mostly balanced with the hoppy bitterness, malty sweetness and alcohol quite pronounced on the finish.

Bottle bb 08/2022. Pours a dark amber cox cola colour with a slightly off white head. Aroma is malty sweet cakiness - some sponge, toffee. Its ok - toffee, malty (similar to, but not as rich as, a fullers vintage). Nice.
Bottle. Brandy colour with a thin head. Aroma is fruity malt. Flavour is malt, dark fruit and a little sweet chocolate. Finish is dry warming fruit.

28th January 2013Clear dark brown beer with a small cream - tan coloured head. Palate is light and low carbonation, semi dry. Light cherry sourness under fairly neutral malt. Pinch of dust. Mild tangy orange and semi dry finish. An older bottle from Kulminator has much more obvious cherry with mildly oxidised caramel malt and a little wet wood. More intense all round and I much preferred the older one.

From notes: Poured clear brown with a touch of orange, and a 1-finger bone-colored head. Vanilla, woody aroma with a touch of caramel. Medium body with a brief finish. Woody vanilla flavor, with a note of leather at the back. Caramel and nutty notes appear in the taste as it warms.

Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Malty aroma with chocolate and some fruits. Taste is malt, chocolate, dark fruits. Nice smooth mouthfeel. Medium carbonation.

Bottle @ Voldby ølmesse. Pours dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, wood, dark fruits. Flavor is malt, caramel, earth, wood, dark fruits, light coffee. Medium body, average carbonation. 310813

330ml bottle. Dark brown ruby tinged colour, foam off-white head leaving alittle lacing and aroma of doughy malt caramel, chocolate & dark fruits. Taste is sweetish biscuity malt, treacle, dark fruit with chocolate, alcohol and a light bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, some residiual sweetness at the finish. Quite drinkable.
Bottle, 0.33. Medium head, with lacing. Black-red colour. Aroma: chocolate, bread, wood, some dark fruits. Flavour: mostly coffe with choclate, plums, not so bitter. Overall: good beer.
Smells like maple syrup caramel. Dark red. Very dark red. Smooth and metallic. Rich. If it was colder it might taste better
Bottle. Dark reddish brown. Sweet aroma like molasses. Taste is sweet malty and some burnt sugar. Medium carbonation. Tan head. Hides alcohol well

Ive had another Traquair beer a few years ago. That one was decent enough for me to try another that was offered me from the source - Scotland. That said it is pretty tame. If I saw it on the shelf at the local store I would probably skip rest past.

Aroma / Appearance - The caramel colored base is ringed with a dask of eggshell hued head. The pair looks nice in the glass as it releases waves of rich chocolate, caramel, and dense heady malts. Black cherries and a hint of vanilla add to the texture of a heavy red wine.

Flavor / Palate - Malt vinegar, bakers chocolate, and fresh tea ruin what could have been a great experience with tastes all over the map. The funky aspects take a promising scotch ale and send it to the land of "never again." You should too.

A deep brown color with ruby highlights but still clear. Has a substantial khaki head made up of tiny bubbles that is creamy with good retention and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma of figs and plumbs as well as molasses some oakiness. Taste is malty with molaases and the dark fruits again. Flavor has a woody character as well as a bit of peat and a hint of alcohol. Finishes with a slight bitterness and some residual sweetness. Mouthfeel borders on being sticky with a medium body and a nice moderate carbonation. Really nice Scotch ale that, while its not overly complex, provides the flavors and aroma that I appreciate in the style. Plus it has a really cool history that.

At Epic Beer Fest 2013. Clear dark muddy copper under a thin beige head. Aroma is faint but earthy and darkly sweet. Flavor is peaty and earthy sweet with some dark Scottish toffee and a toasty aftertaste.

Bouteille de 12 oz. Arômes de fruits confis et de malts caramélisés. Légère présence doxydation (la bière a près de 3 ans). Robe brune aux reflets roux, peu de mousse et effervescence assez faible. En bouche, on retrouve une belle complexité de fruits rouges et mûrs, probablement le résultat dune élégante oxydation, et de malts caramélisés et fumés. Le corps demeure svelte pour le style et lalcool est peu apparent. Finale délicatement sucrée et peu amère. Une scotch ale très facile dapproche.

Best by Jun 2018
500ml served in a snifter
